speaker: Outstanding Sound Mixing for a Comedy Series or Special
text: Thomas J. Huth, David M. Weisharr, Robert Douglass, Dana Mark McClure
nextSpeaker: Outstanding Guest Actress in a Comedy Series

speaker: Outstanding Guest Actress in a Comedy Series
text: Bebe Neuwirth
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Sound Mixing for a Comedy Series or Special
nextSpeaker: Outstanding Guest Actress in a Comedy Series

speaker: Outstanding Guest Actress in a Comedy Series
text: JoBeth Williams    * * *  **This is Part One:[[2.08]](/frasier/transcripts/season_2/episode_8/adventures_in_paradise_1.html "Adventures In Paradise \[1\]")**  * * *  ## Transcript {Mike Lee}    **A BRIEF RECAP BEFORE WE CONTINUE...**
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Guest Actress in a Comedy Series

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o._] I just opened up the pages of "Seattle" magazine, and there she was... _Clips from Scenes One and Four of Part I, in which Frasier meets Madeline Marshall and then agrees to go away with her._
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Guest Actress in a Comedy Series

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o._] So off I flew to Bora Bora, and did I receive the shock of my life... _FADE TO:  ACT ONE  Scene One -- Bora Bora We're back where we left off -- Frasier and Lilith catching sight of each other. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Lilith!  What are you doing here?!

speaker: Lilith
text: I suppose I could ask you the same thing.

speaker: Madeline
text: [_o.s_] Frasier, is everything all right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, yes, yes.  Uh, why don't you come out and join us, Madeline? [_to Lilith_] What about you?  Are you here with someone?

speaker: Lilith
text: Yes.  Actually, he's snorkeling at the moment.

speaker: Frasier
text: Anyone I know?

speaker: Lilith
text: Sam Malone.

speaker: Frasier
text: _Sam?!_

speaker: Lilith
text: Just kidding.

speaker: Frasier
text: Of all places, Lilith, why did you bring him here?

speaker: Lilith
text: Well, it was spectacular five years ago when you brought me, it's even more breathtaking now.

speaker: Frasier
text: But this was our place.  How could you bring someone else? [_Madeline comes out in a robe_] Oh, here.  Lilith, I'd like you to meet Madeline Marshall. [_they shake hands_] How's this for a hoot?  This is my ex-wife, Lilith.

speaker: Madeline
text: Your... ex-wife is here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  It's a shame, too -- no papers to be signed.

speaker: Madeline
text: So you're here with someone?

speaker: Lilith
text: Why does everyone keep asking me that?  Yes, I am. Oh, here he comes now.  Brian? _Brian -- a distinguished-looking man with iron-gray hair and a trim, athletic physique -- walks on drying himself off. _

speaker: Lilith
text: Dr. Brian Patchett, I'd like you to meet Madeline Marshall, and Dr. Frasier Crane.

speaker: Brian
text: [_shaking hands_] Your ex-husband?  You're making a joke!

speaker: Lilith
text: No, God is.

speaker: Brian
text: Pleasure to meet you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Likewise.

speaker: Lilith
text: Uh, Brian is a seismologist at M.I.T.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, that's perfect.  Brian being a seismologist, and you having so many faults. [_Lilith laughs, surprising Frasier_] Lilith, you're laughing!

speaker: Lilith
text: Well, I laugh quite a bit these days, thanks to Brian.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, Madeline is just hilarious!  She also designs her own line of sportswear.

speaker: Lilith
text: I'm sorry, I don't think I've ever worn sportswear.

speaker: Madeline
text: So, how long are you going to stay?

speaker: Lilith
text: Until Tuesday. [_Brian puts his arm around her_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_putting his arm around Madeline_] We're here till Wednesday. _Lilith gives Brian a kiss.  Frasier does the same to Madeline. Suddenly, Lilith grabs Brian and kisses him deeply.  Frasier grabs Madeline and kisses her deeply.  Both keep one eye open on the other._

speaker: Brian
text: Well, this certainly has the potential to be very awkward. Why don't we defuse the situation by getting together for cocktails later?

speaker: Madeline
text: Better yet, let's have dinner.

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, that's a wonderful idea.  Why don't we meet in the Tiki Room -- at six o'clock?

speaker: Madeline
text: Great.

speaker: Frasier
text: Looking forward to it!  What a wonderful way to start out what promises to be the greatest week of our lives! _FADE OUT  Scene Two -- Frasier's Hotel Room Frasier and Madeline come back from dinner.  Frasier is fuming. _

speaker: Frasier
text: You see how Mr. Perfect kept rubbing it in, just to get my goat?

speaker: Madeline
text: Frasier, relax.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, like he had to climb that tree to get her a coconut -- there were three of them on the ground!

speaker: Madeline
text: Would you stop obsessing?  Come here.

speaker: Frasier
text: O.K.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hold it!  What's that?

speaker: Madeline
text: [_whispering_] What's what?

speaker: Frasier
text: Lilith is making love in there!

speaker: Madeline
text: I don't hear a thing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Exactly!

speaker: Madeline
text: Would you just concentrate on me, please?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you're right, you're right.  It's not like it was back in college, when that sort of thing was going on in the next room and I was left all alone with nothing but my dreams and my Henry Miller collection.  You're right, I just got to block it out of my mind, just try to focus and concentrate on the task at hand!

speaker: Madeline
text: [_sarcastic_] Oh, that's sexy.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're right, forgive me.  You want sexy?  I'll show you sexy.

speaker: Madeline
text: I feel dirty.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good!

speaker: Madeline
text: No, no, I mean sandy, from sitting on the beach.  Just let me take a shower.

speaker: Frasier
text: O.K.  Don't be long!

speaker: Madeline
text: When I come back, I'll make you forget you were ever married to Lilith.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's never happened before without a prescription! _Madeline goes into the bathroom.  Frasier takes off his shoes and lies back on the bed._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_relaxing_] Oh yeah, oh yeah. [_gets an idea and turns his head toward the wall; louder_] Oh yeah... oh, it's never been like this before, never! [_puts his ear to the wall_] Nothing -- damn her, she can give as good as she gets! [_starts jumping up and down on the bed_] Oh yeah, oh yeah!  Oh, oh, mama! Oh God, you are so hot!  I am burning up!  Oh, that's it, that's it!  Yes!  Yes! _Lilith and Brian, fully clothed, appear in the doorway; Madeline comes out of the bathroom in a towel.  Not noticing them, Frasier grabs the bed's canopy and rocks it so it slams against the wall._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God, yes!  Keep it up, baby!  You're killing me! Oh God, you're an animal!  YES, YES!

speaker: Madeline
text: Well, obviously you don't need me! **PARADISE LOST** _Scene Three -- KACL Frasier is back doing his show. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, before we go to our "Eye in the Sky" Chopper Dave for the traffic report, I would like to send this confidential message to Madeline M.  Madeline, I'm sure your gentleman would love an opportunity to explain his behavior, but you left the island before he had a chance, and, um, you won't return his calls or answer the notes he's sent.  We all know how hard it is to find love in this world, what a tragedy it is to let it slip through our fingers.  I think he really cares about you. [_Roz taps on the glass_] This is Dr. Frasier Crane, we'll be back in a moment.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, you were wonderful.

speaker: Frasier
text: You really think she'll call?

speaker: Roz
text: If the woman doesn't respond, she doesn't have a heart.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, I almost forgot!  This bill came for you from your hotel in Bora Bora.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_reading it_] Well, it's not too bad.  I guess they had to charge me for the whole week.

speaker: Roz
text: No, that's for the bed you trashed.

speaker: Frasier
text: Twenty-five hundred dollars for bamboo?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, this is Dr. Frasier Crane.  Roz, whom do we have next?

speaker: Roz
text: We have Vic from Seattle on line three.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Vic.  I'm listening.

speaker: Vic
text: [_v.o._] Hi, Dr. Crane, thanks for taking my call.  I'm a first-time caller, I'm a little nervous.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, just relax, Vic -- "I'm listening."

speaker: Vic
text: Yeah, I'm really having a problem with women...

speaker: Roz
text: [_sticking her head in; whispering_] Frasier, Madeline's on line one!

speaker: Vic
text: Dr. Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, uh-uh, Vic, uh, something's come up in the booth, just- you know, I'll have to turn you over to my very capable producer.

speaker: Vic
text: Uh, O.K. _Roz, panicking, mouths "WHAT?!  NO, NO!"  Frasier ignores her and picks up the phone._

speaker: Frasier
text: Madeline, Madeline, hi!  Oh, thanks for calling.  Oh, no, no, it's OK, it's OK, I'm off the air right now.

speaker: Roz
text: So, Vic, uh, what's this trouble you're having with women?

speaker: Vic
text: I don't know.  You know, I have a good job, I think I have a good personality.  'Course, I made more money when I was modeling, but I'm doing O.K. at the law firm.

speaker: Roz
text: [_Bye-bye panic!_] Tell me more. _Scene Four -- Apartment Daphne, Martin, and Niles are dressed for an evening out. _

speaker: Niles
text: Maris will be thrilled you're coming to see her tonight in the ballet.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, we're delighted!

speaker: Martin
text: [_mumbling_] Yeah.

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, when I was younger I dreamed of being a ballerina myself.

speaker: Niles
text: So did Maris!  But the poor thing could never get her weight up enough.  That's why I couldn't help myself at the ballet fundraiser when they auctioned off this walk-on part.  It was the perfect gift for my Maris!

speaker: Martin
text: So Maris is gonna be a ballerina?

speaker: Niles
text: No.  It's non-dancing, but it is a key role, Dad.  She plays Ulrich, the hunchbacked drawbridge operator.

speaker: Martin
text: I hope we can pick her out.

speaker: Frasier
text: What are you people still doing here?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, hush, we'll be long gone before your lady friend gets here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you don't want to be late for the ballet.

speaker: Martin
text: I do!  When those ballet guys start flying around in those tight pants, I don't know where to look!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, that reminds me, I've got to bring my binoculars.

speaker: Frasier
text: Will you just get out of here?!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, will you relax?

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't, it's my last chance with Madeline!  Serves me right, too, after the way I behaved in Bora Bora.

speaker: Niles
text: You're being too hard on yourself, it was just bad luck. How were you to know that Lilith had arrived on the island?

speaker: Martin
text: Aside from the seas starting to churn and all the birds taking flight from the trees.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh now, don't you worry, Dr. Crane.  Miss Marshall's going to forgive you.  Women always appreciate a man who's sensitive enough to try again.  That's why they call us the "fair sex."  All right then, let's go see some leaping Russian stags!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh hi, Maddy!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, hello!  We were just leaving for the ballet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Madeline, come in.

speaker: Niles
text: You two kids take your time.  Don't worry about us, we'll be out all evening.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, you know how it is.  First the ballet, then the inevitable discussion.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that was a little awkward.

speaker: Madeline
text: So is this.

speaker: Frasier
text: I guess there's no delaying it.  I might as well just launch into my little speech, try to explain why I behaved the way I did...

speaker: Madeline
text: You know what might be better?  If I tell you how I've got it worked out.  The minute you saw Lilith, you wanted to leave, but I wouldn't let you.  You said you couldn't handle it, and by God, you were right!  You panicked, and your panic took a bad turn -- a spectacularly bad turn.  Anyway, that's how I've got it worked out in my head, and it's fragile, so let's not mess with it.  So, why don't you mix up a pitcher of Mai- Tai's and give me a kiss?  I'll let you guess which I want first.

speaker: Madeline
text: Guess again. _Frasier disconsolately turns away, but Madeline grabs him and kisses him again.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO_ **WHAT NUMBER SUNBLOCK MUST SHE USE?** _Scene Five -- Apartment Frasier and Madeline are unwinding on the couch with Mai-Tai's and slices of mango on sticks. _

speaker: Madeline
text: Mmm, delicious!  I love mangoes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we never got around to sampling this tropical delicacy while we were in the islands, so I thought we should do it now.

speaker: Madeline
text: Good thinking. [_kisses him_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, there's something else we never got around to in Bora Bora...

speaker: Madeline
text: Well, you got around to it.  I just watched.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, how about a little audience participation this time?

speaker: Madeline
text: Frasier, wait.  I want this as much as you do, but there's something I need to talk to you about first.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Madeline
text: Well, I wasn't going to say anything.  I-I thought I was comfortable with this and I wouldn't have to bring it up, but... well, I was involved with a divorced man once before, and just about the time that I was really falling for him... [_Frasier understands_] He reconciled with his ex-wife, and I'm telling you I just can't go through that again.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's all right, Madeline.  Trust me, I assure you that Lilith and I are completely finished.  She lives clear on the other side of the country.  Except in matters of our son, we don't even have contact.

speaker: Madeline
text: That's all I wanted to hear.

speaker: Madeline
text: Well, what's your name, little fella?

speaker: Frasier
text: You promise you won't laugh?

speaker: Frasier
text: The dog?  His name is Eddie. [_gets up and picks up Eddie_] Come on.  Pardon me while I put him back while he belongs.

speaker: Madeline
text: I'll be waiting. _For a moment Frasier turns toward the balcony, tempted to hurl Eddie over the side... then he just takes him to the hallway.  Madeline picks up a stick of mango.  Someone knocks on the door. She gets up and opens the door to -- Lilith! _

speaker: Madeline
text: Oh God!

speaker: Lilith
text: It's nice to see you too.  Is Frasier here?

speaker: Madeline
text: Don't you live in Boston?!

speaker: Lilith
text: I'm here on a layover -- and judging by Frasier's trademark mangoes on a stick, so are you.  If you like, I can come back in ten minutes.

speaker: Madeline
text: [_getting her things_] That won't be necessary.

speaker: Lilith
text: I apologize for coming at an inopportune moment, but Frasier and I have an agreement that we'll make time for each other if either one of us has something urgent to discuss -- which I do.

speaker: Madeline
text: Take all the time you need.  This whole thing's just a little too complicated for me. _Madeline leaves.  Lilith picks up a mango stick and sits in Martin's Armchair.  Frasier comes out, sees a woman sitting in the chair, and, drawing the obvious conclusion, dims the lights to a seductive level._

speaker: Frasier
text: Put down that mango, my dear.  It's time you tasted the forbidden fruit. [_Lilith turns around_] YAAAHH!!!  Lilith! What are you doing here?!

speaker: Lilith
text: I have something urgent to discuss.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looking around_] What have you done with Madeline?!

speaker: Lilith
text: She was surprised to see me and she left.

speaker: Lilith
text: I hope you're not angry with me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Angry? [_brings the lights back up_]  What do I have to be angry about?  Just because every time I carve out the tiniest little slice of happiness for myself you come along and obliterate it?  My God, woman, I'd drive a stake through your heart, but I don't think anything could kill you!

speaker: Lilith
text: Brian asked me to marry him.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Lilith
text: He wants to stop in Las Vegas on our way home.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're getting married.

speaker: Lilith
text: Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... so am I!

speaker: Lilith
text: Really?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, to Madeline.

speaker: Lilith
text: Well, I just saw Madeline.  She seemed in an awful hurry for someone who's getting married.

speaker: Frasier
text: She had to buy a dress... oh, God, what am I doing?  I'm not getting married.

speaker: Lilith
text: Wow, you really had me going.  Frasier, I don't want to disrupt anything.  Really, I just came here hoping to get your blessing.

speaker: Frasier
text: I could have given you my blessing over the phone.

speaker: Lilith
text: Must you be so churlish?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I think I'm entitled!  I mean, the one comfort in being divorced is that you're both losers.  Eventually, the time comes when one person is the first to move on. And quite frankly, I'd hoped it would be me.

speaker: Lilith
text: Well, I'd hoped it would be me.  And it was!  But, I'd like to think that, had things worked out the other way around, I would have been happy for you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, if you love him, I am happy for you.

speaker: Lilith
text: I do.  Brian has been a dutiful suitor for some time, and I'm convinced to within an acceptable margin of error that he loves me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Does Frederick like him?

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, he's crazy about him.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh...

speaker: Lilith
text: [_seeing it_] Oh, Frasier, Brian could never take your place that way.  You're Frederick's father.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_grateful_] Congratulations. _He hugs her.  Then Martin, Daphne, and Niles come back.  Frasier's body hides Lilith._

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, it looks like they made up!

speaker: Martin
text: AAH!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, everyone.

speaker: Niles
text: Lilith, what a pleasant surprise!  Well, how was Bora Bora? I've never seen you looking quite so tan.

speaker: Daphne
text: My God, what does she look like in winter?

speaker: Frasier
text: Everyone, we have some very happy news: Lilith is going to be married again.

speaker: Martin
text: [_guardedly_] To who?

speaker: Frasier
text: Someone else. _Martin is so overjoyed he drops his cane in his rush across the room to shake Lilith's hand._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that's great!  Congratulations!  Wonderful!

speaker: Niles
text: Just wonderful, when's the happy occasion?

speaker: Lilith
text: Tomorrow, in Las Vegas.

speaker: Niles
text: [_laughs_] Oh, Lilith, how delightfully kitschy!  It's your second marriage, so you've decided to poke fun at the institution by getting married in the tackiest place you could possible choose!

speaker: Lilith
text: Brian's family lives in Las Vegas.

speaker: Niles
text: Well... isn't that convenient?  You'll have someone to show you the museums.

speaker: Lilith
text: It was lovely seeing you all again.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll just walk you out.

speaker: Lilith
text: Well, I hope you haven't found all this too unsettling.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no.  You know, I think it's actually good that you're getting remarried.  I mean, otherwise we could have spent the rest of our lives wondering whether our divorce was a mistake, if we should have tried to work it out.  Was it me, was it you, was it us, was it you?  Now we can move on.

speaker: Lilith
text: What's next for you?

speaker: Frasier
text: I suppose I'll try to smooth things over with Madeline.

speaker: Lilith
text: Try very hard, Frasier.  She seems worth it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, she'll need convincing.  You know, I guess I could ask her back to Bora Bora with me, try again. [_excited_] You know, I'll lay on the whole package this time.  I'll buy the airplane tickets first, pay for the hotel, get a limo, champagne and caviar, the whole nine yards.  With any luck I'll sweep her off her feet and into my bed... I do own it, you know.

speaker: Lilith
text: Would you like to kiss the bride?

speaker: Frasier
text: It'd be my pleasure.

speaker: Lilith
text: You're really happy for me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yes, of course.  You'll understand, though, if I don't jump up and down and yell "Yippee!"

speaker: Lilith
text: [_as the elevator doors close_] Yes, I've already seen that. _And she's gone.  Frasier's not entirely O.K.... but he will be.  FADE TO:  Scene Five -- Bora Bora Exactly as before, Frasier opens the door to his balcony, and looks out at the sea.  Everything is just perfect.  Behind him, Madeline crosses the room wearing only a towel. _

speaker: Madeline
text: Now why don't we pick up where we left off, Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my God...

speaker: Diane
text: Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: OH, MY GOD! _SMASH CUT TO: Frasier starts awake in a deck chair.  He's still in Bora Bora, at the same bungalow, but the balcony next door is empty._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh God, I just had the most frightening dream!  Thank God I'm here with you.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, we have all week to analyze your dream.  Right now, there's a huge bug in the shower! _Frasier sighs, gets up, and ceremoniously removes one shoe. Niles gives him two thumbs up.  END OF ACT TWO_
